project_description: A simple Flutter app that displays a text of an animal (Cat or Dog) and changes the text and icon when clicked.
architecture_overview: The project uses the Cubit pattern for state management. The app has a single screen that displays a text with an icon. The state of the text and icon is managed by a Cubit.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : Clicks on AnimalText
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit : toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> Animal : Update state
Animal -> HomeScreen : New state
HomeScreen -> AnimalText : Update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the AnimalCubit. When the user clicks on the AnimalText, the toggleAnimal method of AnimalCubit is called, which toggles the state between Cat and Dog. The UI rebuilds based on the new state.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which is displayed when the app starts. There is no navigation to other screens.
